topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Post-Alpha Release Build 22: Deploying the Horizon Patch

body.p: This patch updates the Horizon package to incorporate specific UI rebranding changes.

After HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is fully deployed, and is up and running, follow these steps to update the new Horizon package on your cloud:
Login to your HLM host as root:
sudo su -
Delete the existing Horizon Debian package:
rm -f /var/cache/hlm/repo/debian/hoscg-horizon-2015.1.2.481-1.deb
Copy the new Horizon debian you downloaded to /var/cache/hlm/repo/debian on HLM host. You should have downloaded the hoscg-horizon-2015.1.2.487-1.deb file in the prerequisites.
Change to the following directory:
cd /var/cache/hlm/repo/debian
Execute the following to generate the package index. /root/cg-hlm/dev-tools/dpkg-scanpackages --multiversion . /dev/null | gzip -9c > Packages.gz
Perform the following steps on all the controller nodes:
Execute the following command to purge/install Horizon package: apt-get update; apt-get purge hoscg-horizon; apt-get install hoscg-horizon
Execute the following commands on terminal: DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=openstack_dashboard.settings /opt/stack/venvs/horizon/bin/django-admin collectstatic DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=openstack_dashboard.settings /opt/stack/venvs/horizon/bin/django-admin compress Type yes when prompted.
Execute the following command to restart the Apache service: service apache2 restart
Return to the KVM + ESX installation.
